synthesis_analysis:
**Key strengths:** Effective validation, breaking tasks into micro-steps, and leveraging strengths (e.g., data-driven thinking, competitiveness) consistently build confidence. Normalizing challenges and low-stakes reframing (e.g., "experiments") reduce pressure.  

**Main weaknesses:** Missed opportunities to address cognitive distortions (e.g., fear of judgment) and core motivations (e.g., "Why does this matter?"). Over-reliance on humor/self-deprecation sometimes reinforces negative self-talk.  

**Improvements:** 1) Proactively challenge distortions (e.g., "How likely is X to happen?"). 2) Tie tasks to personal goals early. 3) Reduce reinforcing self-deprecation.  

**Priority evolution:** Strengthen distortion-challenging scripts and motivation-linking prompts, while refining pacing (e.g., student-led speed adjustments).
